newsitem.title: USA: Virginia Power sees Surry 2 nuke fully back Friday.
newsitem.headline: Virginia Power sees Surry 2 nuke fully back Friday.

text.p: Virginia Power Co said Thursday that repairs to its 800 megawatt (MW) Surry 2 nuclear power station likely would be completed and the unit restored to full power by Friday.
"We expect to be back at 100 percent by tomorrow morning," a company spokesman said.

The unit's power production was trimmed to about 50 percent overnight while engineers replaced a bearing in one of the three pumps that circulate condensed steam after the steam has spun the generator.
The Surry facility's other unit, number one, is operating at its full 800 MW rated capacity, he said.
The Surry power station is in Gravel Neck, Va.
Virginia Power Co is a subsidiary of Dominion Resources Inc.
